title: Apple Sets Return to Office Date for April 11
sub_head: Tech company joins other major businesses planning to reopen workplaces nearly two years since start of Covid-19 pandemic
body:
Apple Inc. told U.S. employees they will begin returning to the office on April 11, according to a memo Chief Executive Tim Cook sent workers Friday.
The tech giant will implement a phased approach with teams initially returning one day a week before working up to three days a week starting in late May, with Wednesdays and Fridays being flexible.
